Ada Dampak Spyware Israel di Indonesia, WhatsApp?
07 Nov 2019, 15:16 by Adi Fida Rahman - detikInet


Aplikasi WhatsApp. Foto: Getty Images

Jakarta - Ribuan pengguna WhatsApp terdampak serangan spyware atau software mata-mata Pegasus buatan perusahaan Israel, NSO Group. Adakah pengguna Indonesia yang ikut menjadi korban?Pertanyaan itu coba disodorkan pada Direktur Kebijakan WhatsApp APAC Clair Deevy. Sayangnya dia belum bisa memberikan informasi terkait berapa jumlah korban dan ada tidaknya pengguna Indonesia yang ikut terdampak serangan Spyware Pegasus."Saat ini kami telah mengajukan gugatan kepada NSO Group di pengadilan. Jadi kami tidak bisa membagi informasi saat ini, " kata Clair saat ditemui di kantor Kominfo, Kamis (7/11/2019).Clair tidak merinci sejauh mana proses gugatan tersebut berjalan. Dia hanya mengatakan kasus ini sebenarnya tidak mereka harapkan karena WhatsApp begitu menjunjung privasi penggunanya."Menjadi komitmen kami untuk menjaga privasi dan enkripsi. Kami melihat bahwa hal-hal seperti ini (Spaware Pegasus-red) bukan kasus yang kami inginkan. Itulah mengapa kami mengajukan gugatan di AS terhadap NSO," tegas Clair.Seperti diketahui Serangan Pegasus ini diduga terjadi bulan Mei 2019 kepada 1.400 pengguna WhatsApp di seluruh dunia, memanfaatkan celah keamanan di panggilan WhatsApp. Setidaknya 100 orang korban adalah para aktivis politik dan HAM, wartawan atau pejabat pemerintahan.Ketika masuk ke ponsel korban, Pegasus bisa mengambil semua data seluler berupa foto, email, nomor kontak, lokasi, arsip, data history browsing, rekaman audio dan kamera.Will Catchart, Head of WhatsApp mengatakan targetnya adalah data penting di ponsel korban. WhatsApp dibobol untuk dijadikan jalan masuk dari kode-kode jahat ke ponsel korban."User akan menerima apa yang kelihatannya video call, tapi ini bukan panggilan normal," kata Will Catchart.Setelah ponsel berbunyi, penyerang diam-diam mentransmisikan kode jahat sebagai upaya menginfeksi ponsel korban dengan spyware untuk membaca pesan dan informasi lain. Pihak yang disasar bahkan tak perlu menerima panggilan itu.Pegasus hanya butuh nomor ponsel korban untuk mengirimkan kode-kode jahat. Tak cuma itu, Pegasus pun bisa menyusup tanpa jejak, dengan konsumsi baterai yang minimal agar tak menimbulkan kecurigaan."(Pegasus) tak meninggalkan jejak, konsumsi baterai, memori dan penggunaan data yang minimal, serta mempunyai opsi untuk menghapus diri sendiri yang bisa digunakan setiap saat," tambah pihak WhatsApp. Simak Video "Menkominfo Bicara Soal Ancaman Mata-mata Pegasus Milik Israel"[Gambas:Video 20detik](afr/fyk)

Is there an Impact of Israeli Spyware in Indonesia, WhatsApp?
Nov 7 2019, 15:16 by Adi Fida Rahman - detikInet


WhatsApp application. Photo: Getty Images

Jakarta - Thousands of WhatsApp users are affected by spyware attacks or Pegasus spy software made by Israeli company, NSO Group. Are there any Indonesian users who were victims? The question was offered by the Policy Director of WhatsApp APAC Clair Deevy. Unfortunately he has not been able to provide information regarding the number of victims and whether Indonesian users were affected by the Spyware Pegasus attack. "At the moment we have filed a lawsuit with the NSO Group in court. So we cannot share information at this time," Clair said when met at Kominfo office, Thursday (11/07/2019). Clair did not specify the extent to which the proceedings proceeded. He only said that this case is actually not expected because WhatsApp respects the privacy of its users. "It is our commitment to maintain privacy and encryption. We see that things like this (Spaware Pegasus-ed) are not cases that we want. That is why we submit a lawsuit in the US against NSO, "Clair stressed. As we know, the Pegasus attack is thought to have occurred in May 2019 to 1,400 WhatsApp users worldwide, exploiting security holes in WhatsApp calls. At least 100 victims are political and human rights activists, journalists or government officials. When entering the victim's cellphone, Pegasus can retrieve all cellular data in the form of photos, emails, contact numbers, locations, archives, browsing history data, audio recordings and cameras. Will Catchart, Head of WhatsApp said the target was important data on the victim's cellphone. WhatsApp was broken into as an entry point for malicious code to the victim's cellphone. "Users will receive what appears to be a video call, but this is not a normal call," Will Catchart said. After the phone sounds, the attacker secretly transmits the bad code in an attempt to infect victim's cellphone with spyware to read messages and other information. The targeted party does not even need to receive the call. Pegasus only needs the victim's cellphone number to send malicious codes. Not only that, Pegasus can infiltrate without a trace, with minimal battery consumption so as not to arouse suspicion. "(Pegasus) leaves no trace, minimal battery consumption, memory and data usage, and has the option to erase yourself which can be used every when, "added the WhatsApp. Check out the video "Minister of Communication and Information Talks About the Threat of Israeli Pegasus Spies" [Gambas: Video 20second] (afr / fyk)
